episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features discussions on historical and unusual facts about American presidents and their sheep, a Russian village where everyone can tightrope walk, pedestrian behavior in different countries, and the conservation efforts for California condors using glove puppets.

facts.fact: Twice in its history, America has been run by a shepherd.
There is a village in Russia where every single person knows how to tightrope walk.
In Britain, pedestrians step to the right to avoid each other, and in Japan, they step to the left.
Half of all California condors were raised by glove puppets.
